com.burstly.conveniencelayer
Class BurstlyInterstitial

java.lang.Object
  com.burstly.conveniencelayer.BurstlyBaseAd
      com.burstly.conveniencelayer.BurstlyInterstitial
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICacheable
public class BurstlyInterstitial
extends BurstlyBaseAd
implements ICacheable

BurstlyInterstitial should be used with zones marked as interstitial zones in the burstly.com UI and will be launched in their own activity. The Activity launched will depend on who the ad provider is and the type of ad. For Burstly house and direct ads, as well as server side feeds the BurstlyFullscreenActivity. For other providers whose SDKs are integrated into the Burstly SDK there own Activities will be used. See the documentation for the necessary manifest entries

Constructor Detail

BurstlyInterstitial

public BurstlyInterstitial(Activity activity,
                           String zoneId,
                           String viewName,
                           boolean autoCache)
Constructs a BurstlyInterstitial used for retrieving and triggering an interstitial shown in a new Activity

Parameters:
activity - The Activity where the interstitials are requested from and will be launched from
zoneId - The zoneId for these interstitials
viewName - The name of this view which will be used to identify it in teh logs
autoCache - Do you want the caching of ads automatically managed for you?

Method Detail

resumed

protected void resumed()
Called by the convenience layer when the activity or fragment associated with this ad is paused.

Overrides:
resumed in class BurstlyBaseAd

showAd

public void showAd()
Shows an ad. If an ad is already precached it will show immediately. If an ad has not been precached it will send a request for a new ad. If an ad is precaching it will wait until it completes before sending a request

Overrides:
showAd in class BurstlyBaseAd

Gets whether there is a cached ad ready to be shown

Specified by:

Returns:
true if a cached ad is available to be shown. False otherwise.

Gets whether an ad is being retrieved and cached currently

Specified by:
isCachingAd in interface ICacheable
Returns:
